newsitem.title: EGYPT: Cairene bank proposing pound bonds.
newsitem.headline: Cairene bank proposing pound bonds.

text.p: National Societe Generale Bank said on Tuesday it was proposing to issue Egyptian pound bonds worth up to 150 million pounds ($44 million).
The bank, in which French bank Societe Generale has held a majority stake since last October, said it also wanted to split its shares 10-for-one.
The board will put the proposals to shareholders at an extraordinary general assembly on February 13.
The bank said it had sent out details of the bond proposal to shareholders. Bank officials were not available to elaborate.
Other recent Egyptian bank bond issues have been at 0.25 percent above the yield on six-month treasury bills, which now stands at 10.041 percent.
